channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger Steps Down Amid Chipmaker’s Struggles
item.description: Pat Gelsinger stepped down after nearly four years at the helm of the company, Intel said Monday.

item.title: U.N. Suspends Aid Deliveries to Gaza via Kerem Shalom Crossing
item.description: The head of the U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees blamed Israel for failing to ensure safe conditions for delivering relief supplies from the Kerem...

item.title: Germany Pledges Fast Military Aid to Ukraine in Effort to Reassure
item.description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz visited Kyiv on Monday. Amid fears that U.S. support could dry up, Ukrainian officials had criticized him for a recent phone ca...

item.title: ‘Elon Musk is right,’ Bernie Sanders admits, agreeing the defense budget needs to be cut because the Pentagon has ‘lost track of billions’
item.description: The unlikely duo have their eyes on the Department of Defense, which has repeatedly failed its audits.

item.title: A Culture-War Battle Convulses a School Panel in Liberal Manhattan
item.description: Maud Maron, a right-wing activist, introduced a resolution about transgender students’ participation in sports. The fallout has derailed a parent coun...

item.title: Getty Images CEO: Respecting fair use rules won’t prevent AI from curing cancer
item.description: The creative community has mobilized against the unauthorized use of their collective text, music, photography, and video by AI model makers.

item.title: France’s Opposition Parties Call for No-Confidence Vote Over Budget Bill
item.description: Prime Minister Michel Barnier pushed a budget bill through the lower house of Parliament without a vote. A no-confidence vote could topple the governm...

item.title: Germany Pledges Fast Military Aid to Ukraine in Effort to Reassure
item.description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz visited Kyiv on Monday. Amid fears that U.S. support could dry up, Ukrainian officials had criticized him for a recent phone ca...

item.title: Investors Punish France Over Budget Turmoil
item.description: The country’s borrowing costs have soared over worries that a political showdown in Parliament over spending cuts and tax increases could topple a fra...

item.title: An Arctic Hamlet is Sinking Into the Thawing Permafrost
item.description: Canada is losing its permafrost to climate change. The Indigenous residents of Tuktoyaktuk know they’ll have to move but don’t agree on when.

item.title: Centrist Party Edges Out Far-Right Challengers in Romania
item.description: The center-left Social Democrats won the most votes in a parliamentary election but a strong nationalist showing could make it difficult to form a sta...

item.title: A 17-year-old hockey player died during a charity game to honor another teenager who had died in a car crash
item.description: Connor Kasin lost consciousness during a game benefiting a foundation set up by the parents of 19-year-old Sabrina Navaretta.

item.title: Best Movies of 2024
item.description: Our film critics rank their 10 favorites this year.

item.title: Intel CEO forced out after board grew frustrated with progress
item.description: CFO David Zinsner and Michelle Johnston Holthaus, who is taking on a new role as CEO of the company’s product group, are serving as interim co-CEOs.

item.title: If you buy all the gifts from ‘The 12 Days of Christmas’ this year, you will pay way more than you did last year
